FILE: cm630680v11.0.txt
DYAD: IRAN - YEMEN PEOPLES REPUBLIC(S.)
RIVALRY: RIV1192
DISPUTE(S): MID2959 

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20181006
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20181006

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

MID2959

TERRMID: MID2959 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID2959 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID2959 from Gibler 2018 and cm narrative, South Yemen shot down an Iranian fighter that flew into South Yemeni airspace from Oman in 1976. The pilot was later released to Saudi Arabia. Coded not territory because they were not disputing a land boundary. 

TERRLINK: MID2959 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2959 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2959 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2959 1 -- certain
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2959 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2959 1 -- certain
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2959 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2959 1 -- certain
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2959 3 -- not civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2959 1 -- certain
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2959 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2959 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2959 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2959 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

RIVNOTES: 

NARRATIVE-CM:
South Yemen troops shot down an Iranian military aircraft that had crossed the border from Oman on November 25, 1976, resulting in the death of an Iranian pilot and the capture of an Iranian pilot. South Yemen turned over the captured Iranian pilot to Saudi Arabia on December 21, 1976. Iran and South Yemen established diplomatic relations on April 23, 1981.

SOURCES-CM: 
*Keesing*, March 6, 1981; *Middle East Journal *(MEJ), Spring 1977.

NARRATIVE-CR:

SOURCES-CR:

SOURCES: Gibler, D.M. 2018. Militarized Interstate Dispute Narratives, 1816-2010. Langham, MD: Rowman and Littlefield.
